means: 不轻易暴露想法或感情

sentence.Network_en: Pearl didn't mind his reticence; in fact she liked it.
sentence.Network_cn: 珀尔并不介意他沉默寡言；事实上，她喜欢这一点。

sentence.Network_en: Her reticence was in sharp contrast to the glamour and star status of her predecessors.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的寡言少语和前任们的光鲜亮丽、明星范儿十足形成了鲜明的对比。

sentence.Network_en: He breaks out of his normal reticence and tells me the whole story.
sentence.Network_cn: 他打破了平时一贯沈默寡言的习惯,把事情原原本本都告诉了我.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE 同义词总结大全 ... mute adj． 沉默的，n．弱音器 reticence n 无言,沉默,谨慎 | tacit adj． 心照不宣的，静默的.
GRE分类词汇--by 武汉新东方刘畅_百度文库 ... （tranquil adj. 宁静的，安静的） （reticence n. 沉默寡言） （portent n. 预兆，凶兆…
第172-2条用“缄默”（reticence）一词代替了“疏忽”（omission）。二者的含义似乎没什么区别，用后一个词是因为它更通俗。

list.abs: His reticence is more revealing than his speech ., 他的沉默所表露的要胜过他的言词.

the mermaid in the deep sea , it is brilliant that no matter how lights on the bankare . debark , what is done ? is a beautiful one interspersed , or a reticent onlooker ?深海中的人鱼，无论岸上灯火如何辉煌．上岸，去做什么?一个美丽的点缀，还是一个沉默的旁观者？
He always displays a certain reticence in discussing personal matters ., 他在谈论个人问题时总显得有些保留.
reticent knowledge and classroom teaching of teachers ., 教师的缄默知识与课堂教学.

entry.tran: 沉默寡言的;不与人交谈的
entry.def: Someone who is reticent does not tell people about things.

example.ex: She is so reticent about her achievements...
example.tran: 她对自己的成就缄口不言。

example.ex: Mrs. Smith, normally a reticent woman, took it upon herself to write to the President.
example.tran: 通常都很沉默的史密斯夫人决定自己给总统写信。

means.word_mean: 1. the trait of being uncommunicative; not volunteering anything more than necessary

auth_sentence.content: In his new work, there is no such reticence.
auth_sentence.res_content: In his new work, there is no such reticence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In his new work, there is no such reticence.

auth_sentence.content: That strange Anglo-Irish blend of reticence and emotionalism.
auth_sentence.res_content: That strange Anglo-Irish blend of reticence and emotionalism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That strange Anglo-Irish blend of reticence and emotionalism.

auth_sentence.content: They tore off...even the fig-leaves of decent reticence.
auth_sentence.res_content: They tore off...even the fig-leaves of decent reticence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They tore off...even the fig-leaves of decent reticence.

means.word_mean: 不轻易暴露想法或感情;沉默,缄默

sentences.en: His reticence is more revealing than his speech.
sentences.cn: 他的沉默所表露的要胜过他的言词。

sentences.en: He breaks out of his normal reticence and tells me the whole story.
sentences.cn: 他打破了平时一贯沈默寡言的习惯,把事情原原本本都告诉了我。
